definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: As Marines, we do not always like change.
sentences.chinese: 作爲海軍陸戰隊，我們不大喜歡改變。

sentences.english: The Army and Marine Corps have 80 systems in theater.
sentences.chinese: 陸軍和海軍陸戰隊在戰場上有80套系統。

sentences.english: Unhardened webs can be destroyed by marines walking through them without causing the player to get entangled.
sentences.chinese: 淬硬網，可摧毀海軍陸戰隊穿過他們造成球員糾纏。

sentences.english: They say the marines have designed and built the monument all by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 據說這座紀念碑是由海軍陸戰隊獨立設計並建造的。

sentences.english: An estimated 1, 300 Japanese were killed by the Marines in this operation. (AP Photo)
sentences.chinese: 約1300日軍在這場戰鬥中被海軍陸戰隊打死。

sentences.english: Both men were U.S. Marines assigned to Alpha Company, Battalion 1/8.
sentences.chinese: 兩人生前均服役於美國海軍陸戰隊8團1營A連。

sentences.english: He decided to enlist in the Marines.
sentences.chinese: 他決定入伍當美國海軍陸戰隊士兵。

sentences.english: U. S. Marines play a game of "Risk" by flashlight in Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 美海軍陸戰隊在手電筒下玩着一款冒險遊戲，阿富汗。

sentences.english: They were among the more than six-thousand Marines killed on Iwo Jima.
sentences.chinese: 他們之間在硫磺島死亡600多千海軍陸戰隊。

sentences.english: Navy Corpsmen are usually referred to as Corpsmen or Docs.
sentences.chinese: 海軍陸戰隊醫務兵通常被稱作醫務兵或醫生。

sentences.english: Following the  placement of the wreath, the marines will lower the flag to half staff.
sentences.chinese: 在敬獻花圈後，美國海軍陸戰隊員將降半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: The Marines have been using the M777A2 since 2009.
sentences.chinese: 海軍陸戰隊2009年以來一直使用的M777A2。

sentences.english: In your opinion, what kind of people want to join USMC?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得什麼樣的人會想加入海軍陸戰隊呢？

sentences.english: I was 18, on my first weekend pass from the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 那是我加入美國海軍陸戰隊後的第一個週末。

sentences.english: Combat Operations Centers are the focal point of decision-making for Marine Corps commanders and their staffs.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥作戰中心是海軍陸戰隊司令官及參謀的決策焦點。

sentences.english: The Marines placed the flagpole in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 海軍陸戰隊放置在地面的旗杆。

definition: to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
McCain (name)/John McCain (1936-2018), US Republican politician, Senator for Arizona 1987-2018

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Wei3 yuan2 hui4

definition: lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
